alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 12:16PM AKST until January 19 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FRONTAL PASSAGE THURSDAY IS EXPECTED TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE HIGHWAYS... .A front is forecast to pass through the Alaska Panhandle Thursday. With warmer temps at sea level, a rain and snow mix with minor accumulations is possible. But with colder weather in place on the Haines and Klondike Highways, accumulating snow is looking likely. Some uncertainty is in this forecast due to the southerly flow, so if the warmer air and rain is able to move northward faster than expected, then snowfall amounts will be lower. And if the cold air stays in place longer, higher snow amounts are also possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 5 inches at higher elevations near Haines Customs and White Pass. Less than 2 inches expected at sea level. * WHERE...Klondike and Haines Highway. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall rates are expected in the morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Have extra supplies in your vehicle incase of breakdowns or getting stuck. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

area.areaDesc: Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway
